organizations: Cleveland By CRAIG MERZ Associated Press

thread.title: LeBron thrills fans at Ohio State in Cavs' loss to Memphis
thread.title_full: LeBron thrills fans at Ohio State in Cavs' loss to Memphis

title: LeBron thrills fans at Ohio State in Cavs' loss to Memphis
text:
LeBron thrills fans at Ohio State but Memphis gets 91-81 preseason win against Cleveland By CRAIG MERZ Associated Press   9:48   9:49   
People: 
Ohio (773) 

COLUMBUS, Ohio — LeBron James scored 14 points, thrilling fans with a breakaway dunk, but Cleveland lost to Memphis 91-81 in a preseason game at Ohio State on Monday night. 
James, who only played 25 minutes, is a huge fan of the Buckeyes and has a locker in the men's basketball facility. 
Zach Randolph had 14 points to lead the Grizzlies and former Buckeyes guard Mike Conley added four points. 
GRIZZLIES: Conley was 0-for-4 from the floor, made all four free throws and had six assists. 
CAVALIERS: James' first basket was a 3-pointer with 10:33 left in the first quarter. 
SIDELINED: For the Cavaliers, F Kevin Love (dislocated shoulder), G J.R. Smith (hamstring), G Mo Williams (maintenance), G Kyrie Irving (fractured knee cap) and Iman Shumpert (wrist). For Memphis, F Jarrell Martin (foot fracture). 
UP NEXT: The Grizzlies hosts Oklahoma City on Friday. Milwaukee plays Tuesday at Cleveland.
